intro: Piqueria pinifolia, commonly known as the Mexican mountain sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has small, narrow leaves that are covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Piqueria pinifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often used in traditional medicine by local communities.
